articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel intensified strikes on Gaza hours after a ceasefire and hostage release deal was announced, residents and authorities in the Palestinian enclave said, and mediators sought to quell fighting ahead of the truce's start on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas ceasefire accord followed by airstrikes on Gaza, residents say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's anti-corruption agency will resume questioning impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol at 2 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Thursday afternoon, the Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea's anti-corruption agency to resume questioning Yoon on Thursday afternoon, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Ukraine to sign a new 100-year partnership to deepen security ties, the prime minister's office said in a statement on Thursday.
articles.title: UK PM Starmer to travel to Ukraine to sign new treaty

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A last-minute glitch surfaced on Thursday in the details of the Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal and U.S. envoys are working to resolve it, a U.S. official said.
articles.title: US envoys working to resolve last-minute dispute over Gaza deal, US official says

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby, Christy Santhosh
articles.description: The World Health Organization called for the international community to step up and fund a scaled-up aid response in Gaza after Israel and Hamas reached a ceasefire deal to end 15 months of war in the region earlier this week.
articles.title: WHO calls for international support to fund aid in Gaza after ceasefire deal

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Iraq is trying to convince powerful armed factions in the country that have fought U.S. forces and fired rockets and drones at Israel to lay down their weapons or join official security forces, Foreign Minister Fuad Hussein said.
articles.title: Iraq wants Iran-backed factions to lay down weapons, foreign minister says

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's return to the White House next week threatens freedoms at home and abroad, the head of Human Rights Watch said on Thursday, warning that his second term could be more damaging than his first.
articles.title: Human Rights Watch chief says Trump's return threatens freedoms

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: The boxy, machine gun-equipped vehicle lumbered across the snow-covered battlefield, with no crew aboard and marking what its remote Ukrainian operators described as a major milestone as Russian artillery fire rained around it.
articles.title: Ukrainian brigade pioneers remote-controlled ground assaults

articles.author: Jorge Garcia, Lisa Richwine
articles.description: Wind gusts and dry conditions will linger throughout the day on Thursday in Los Angeles where firefighters hope to gain on their momentum against two major wildfires that have ravaged everything in their path.
articles.title: Weather conditions in Los Angeles improve, giving firefighters respite

articles.author: Kristina Cooke, Ted Hesson
articles.description: Blanca Figueroa and Severiano Martinez have known from the start of their eight-year marriage that she was at risk of deportation because she entered the United States illegally.
articles.title: The migrants on the frontline of Trump’s mass deportation plan
